result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory J. Fazekas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory J. Fazekas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Victim Notice of Rights & Victim Notification Card - Returned

Court calls 15CF189, 16CF214, 16CF252, 16CM217 & 16CM226  @ 10:40 am. Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in court and in custody with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  off the record @ 10:42 am. reconvene @ 10:44 am.  State gives plea agreement, 15CF189, received revocation summary  and no corrections, 195 days credit, 3 years initial confinement 3 yrs extended supervision consecutive 11CF74, 16CF214 ct 1 plea, DRI ct's 2 & 3, 16CM217 DRI, 16CM226 DRI, 16CF252 plea to ct 1, ct 2 DRI, 2, 16CM214 & 16CF252  5 years, 2 yrs initial confinement 3 yrs extended supervision concurrent to each other and 15CF189 no contact with D.J.,  Anger Management and any other counseling, costs. Victim rights complied.  Atty Dodge & def. agree to plea agreement.  16CF252  Def. admits prior convictions.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Waiver of p.h. examination filed. Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information Filed.  Atty Dodge has copy of information. Clerk questions if information in 16CF214.  No information. off the record @ 10:54 am. reconvene @ 10:58 am.  Information Filed 16CF214   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing and agrees was given rights.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause.  15CF189 State has revocation summary, Atty Dodge has revocation summary and no corrections.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders on 15CF189 Ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision consecutive to 11CF74, 195 days credit.  Def is not eligible for Challenge or Substance. Conditions of supervision No contact with A.G. (victim), Follow through with treatment recommendation deemed by agent,  Court obligations to be paid during supervision. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF214, ct 1 no contest, 16CF252 ct 1 no contest  16CF214 ct's 2 & 3 DRI, 16CF252 DRI ct 2.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements.  Atty Dodge is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given. Court accepts plea and finds def Guilty to 16CF214 Fleeing, Bodily Harm in ct 1 and 16CF252 Ct 1 Battery to Prisoner, repeater.   Def. makes statement. Court orders on 
16CF214 Ct 1 5 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF189, consecutive to 11CF74, conditions to extended no contact with victim and follow through treatment recommendation deemed by agent and costs, DNA surcharge. 
16CF252 Ct 1 5 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to 16CF214 & 15CF189, consecutive to 11CF74
Extended supervision conditions, No contact with D.J. (victim), Anger Management counseling, costs, DNA Surcharge any other counseling deemed by agent.
Def. is not eligible for Challenge or Substance Abuse program.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Def. advised of postconviction rights. 
DRI 16CM217 & 16CM226 State has complied with victim rights.  16CF214 Restitution 974.  Court orders Restitution $974.00.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution (Copy)
Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation
Request/Agreement For Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:50 a.m./Court calls 15-CF-189 and 15-CM-64.  Plea agreement.  15-CM-64/Sentencing after revocation - 6 months jail, 135 days credit - completed, costs - convert to civil judgment.  DOC surcharge not to be included.  $475.55.  15-CF-189/Def. will withdraw NGI plea.  Def. was found competent.  Def. will plead no contest to battery by prisoner.  Agreement - sentence withhed, 2 years probation, restitution, costs, 153 days credit if revoked.  Dismiss repeater.  Charge is battery by prisoner, a Class H Felony.  Information amended on the record.  Def.'s Atty. has revocation packet in 15-CM-64.  Parties have no additions or corrections.  Court allows amendment to information in 15-CF-189 dropping repeater.  Plea advisement filed.  Def. understands charge.  Def. pleads no contest to 15-CF-189 as amended.  Court gives Def. constitutional rights.  Def. understands waiving jury trial and rights.  Def. understands elements and penalty.  Def. advised of deportation if not citizen.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court accepts plea and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 as amended.  State informs Court of victim impact statement and request for restitution of $10,000.  $568.83 restitution to Sheriff's Dept.  State makes statement regarding sentencing.  Def.'s Atty. makes statement regarding sentencing.  Court will not be making any ruling in regard to victim restitution today.  Def. makes statement to Court.  15-CM-64/Court orders 6 months jail with credit for 135 days served.  Any outstanding costs converted to civil judgment - $176.00 plus $200.00 DNA plus $10.00 and $67.00 victim surcharge.  15-CF-189/Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation, costs including $250 DNA surcharge.  DNA sample not required if already given.  Credit for 153 days if probation revoked.  $568.83 restitution to Langlade County Sheriff's Dept.  Victim's restitution to be determined - hearing may be requested.  Def. advised of postconviction rights - form already completed - also applies to 15-CM-64.  15-FO-241/Def. to be on payment plan.
Further proceedings on June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Further proceedings on April 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in custody.  Jill Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF189, 11CF74 and 15CM64 called @ 2:05 p.m. 11CF74 waiting decision on revocation. 15CM64 waiting sentencing after revocation. 15CF189 not guilty plea has been entered. Competency evaluation has been done. State has received copy of report. State advises does not have copy of revocation report in 15CM64. Atty Goetz also does not have copy. 15CF189 - Not guilty plea previously entered. Atty Goetz wishes to add plea of not guilty by mental disease or defect. Court directs both pleas be entered and will order an NGI evaluation. Off the record 2:17. Back on the record 2:19. Report due by 3/18/16. Further proceedings set for 3/29/16 on 15CF189 and 15CM64. 11CF74 status conf. at same time. State asks for clarification of proceedings on 3/29/16. Statement regarding competency report by the Court. Atty Goetz does not dispute report. Court finds Defendant competent. Court clarifies possible sentence after revocation on 3/29/16 and status on issue of NGI report. Issue of revocation packet distribution addressed, cover memo indicates all parties were copied. Atty Goetz does have copy. State requests copy from the Court. JA will provide copy to State.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in court via video with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel has met with def.  Def wishes to waive preliminary.  Def will be coming over to court house.  Recess.  Def is now present in the court room, with counsel. DA present  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing.  Waiver of preliminary examination form completed and reviewed.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court will accept waiver.  Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will accept not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in court via video with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint was left at the jail.  Counsel indicates that def would not see him.  Statement by def.  Statement by jailer.  Def request to see his attorney.  Matter adjouned until later

Defendant Cory J. Fazekas in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def does not have a copy of complaint.  Copy will be provided.  Court reviews complaint with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.   State questions def if on probation hold.  State request cash bond.  Bond set by Court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
